title: About

title: OW2 Season 4
text: The objective of this project is to identify the optimal team compositions for Overwatch 2 (OW2) Season 4 and compare these with the compositions used in professional play. Using metrics such as K/D/A ratio, pick rates, win rates, eliminations per 10 minutes, damage per 10 minutes, healing per 10 minutes, and deaths per 10 minutes, we will analyze the top 5 heroes in each role (Tank, Damage, and Support). From these rankings, we will determine the best team composition consisting of one Tank, two Damage, and two Support heroes. Finally, this optimal composition will be compared to the meta composition used by professional teams during the OWL Season 4 tournament to draw insights and conclusions.

title: Sources
text:
The data used for this project came from Kaggle. The user that input this data is a data analyst that works for team 4 at Activision Blizzard (OW2 Team). They had submitted this data after the conclusion of season 4 making the data the most accurate data that can be found wiithout working direcctly for team 4.
The meta compositions featured from OWL in this project were collected from the OWL Midseason Madness Tournament which took place at the end of Season 4 of OW2.

title: OWL Comparison
text:
There were two main compositions used in the Overwatch League during season 4.
The first composition was a dive composition that included Winston as the Tank, Sombra and Tracer as the Damage, and the support line was a mix of either Brigitte and Ana or Kiriko and Ana.
The second team composition was a rush composition that included Rammatra as the Tank, a mix of Mei and Sombra or Mei and Sojourn as the Damage line, and a mix of Ana Brigitte or Ana Lucio for the Support Line.
